meanings.definition: A liquid that has been filtered through a membrane to remove particles.
meanings.sent1: The ultrafiltrate collected after passing through the membrane was clear and particle-free.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the ultrafiltrate under a microscope to analyze the removed particles.
meanings.sent3: The ultrafiltrate decided it was tired of carrying particles around and wanted to be pure and clear.
meanings.sent4: The ultrafiltrate flowed through the membrane like a river cleansing itself of impurities.
meanings.sent5: The ultrafiltrate sparkled in the sunlight, free from any unwanted particles.

meanings.definition: To filter a liquid through a membrane to remove particles.
meanings.sent1: She carefully ultrafiltrated the solution to ensure all particles were removed.
meanings.sent2: The lab technician ultrafiltrates the liquid to purify it before conducting experiments.
meanings.sent3: The filter felt proud as it ultrafiltrated the liquid, knowing it was doing a great job.
meanings.sent4: The process of ultrafiltrating the liquid was like separating wheat from chaff.
meanings.sent5: He ultrafiltrated the mixture with precision, separating the particles effectively.
